definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to treat utterly sincerely/open and above board in dealing with sb
see 刮目相看[gua1 mu4 xiang1 kan4]

sentences.english: To me, it was just a matter of being candid with the resident natives.
sentences.chinese: 对于我来说，只需与当地居民坦诚相待即可。

sentences.english: Always be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对你的孩子一向要以诚相待。

sentences.english: Lin Ch'ung stayed with Ch'ai Chin in the village for several days and was entertained by Ch'ai Chin every day.
sentences.chinese: 柴进留林冲在庄上一连住了几日，每日好酒好食相待。

sentences.english: So long as both sides treat each other sincerely, their ties will become even closer.
sentences.chinese: 只要双方坦诚相待，我们的关系会更加密切。

sentences.english: When people trust each other, they become vulnerable to cheats.
sentences.chinese: 当人们以诚相待时，他们很容易受骗。

sentences.english: She could consult with her brother, could receive her sister-in-law on her arrival, and treat her with proper attention;
sentences.chinese: 她遇事能同哥哥商量着办，嫂子来了能以礼相待。

sentences.english: He gave me the cold shoulder at the party.
sentences.chinese: 他在聚会上对我冷眼相待。

sentences.english: Spring and autumn do not treat each other, do not change the water a long moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 春去秋来不相待，水中月色长不改。

sentences.english: The sextile of Venus and Uranus in the composite chart indicates a relationship that is very free and open in its expression.
sentences.chinese: 这将意味着一段非常自由并能坦诚相待的关系。

sentences.english: Is not a child of God worth patience?T-5.
sentences.chinese: 难道上主的孩子不配你以耐心相待吗？

sentences.english: We work hard with each other in good faith to each other and with sensors and happy with.
sentences.chinese: 我们用心彼此真诚相待，彼此感应着，快乐着。

sentences.english: Avoid any hassles. Be honest if you wish to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 想要解决问题就要坦诚相待。

sentences.english: So how do we wrest back control and start being civil to each other again?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何夺回控制权，彼此重新开始以礼相待？

sentences.english: Netiquette requires that people should be polite in their exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 网上礼节要求人们以礼相待。

sentences.english: I have made it a rule always to pay respect with respect.
sentences.chinese: 我已把以礼相待作为一条准则。

sentences.english: Maybe you see someone you don't really like, but you have to be polite.
sentences.chinese: 也许您看到您不太喜欢的人，但又必须以礼相待。

definition: to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to treat utterly sincerely/open and above board in dealing with sb
to welcome sb with a smiling face (idiom)
to make a concession/to be accommodating
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
